title: Tandem Connectionist Feature Extraction for Conversational Speech Recognition

Method or a data driven nonlinear feature transform.
Then the output of the MLP's are used as features too widely used hidden Markov model and this is called tandem scheme.
My presentation is about the work extends the second approach.
So here I will present some properties of the MLP based transform.
The recognition system set up and the recognition performance was this novel feature.
So it is about features.
Sometimes we got questions so it will feel strange while we're using the output from one classifier as the input of another classifier.
We know that the output of MRP, if it bears the meaning of phone posterior approximation.
In the next slides, we will show that the MLP output has some good properties which enables it to be used as a very good feature for speech recognition.
For example, we will show that.
The MLP outputs have.
Regular within class distributions in feature space and with very simple class boundaries for such a feature is easier to model with the HMM.
Also, the MLP outputs.
It is able to reduce the target irrelevant information.
For example the speaker variations.
We will also show that it is easier.
It is much easier to combine different MLP outputs.
And this is very effective in improving the recognition performance without increasing the feature dimensionality, so we don't have the problem of the curse of dimensionality.
So we will show this in the in more details in next field.
Ads.
The first is that as we said, the MLP outputs have simple and regular within class distribution.
Because of the MLP output bears the meaning of phone posterior approximation.
